comment.text: Catalytic subunit of the dimeric UBA3-NAE1 E1 enzyme. E1 activates NEDD8 by first adenylating its C-terminal glycine residue with ATP, thereafter linking this residue to the side chain of the catalytic cysteine, yielding a NEDD8-UBA3 thioester and free AMP. E1 finally transfers NEDD8 to the catalytic cysteine of UBE2M. Down-regulates steroid receptor activity. Necessary for cell cycle progression.
Binding of TP53BP2 to the regulatory subunit NAE1 decreases activity.
Heterodimer of UBA3 and NAE1. Interacts with NEDD8, UBE2F and UBE2M. Binds ESR1 and ESR2 with bound steroid ligand (By similarity). Interacts with TBATA (By similarity).
Arg-211 acts as a selectivity gate, preventing misactivation of ubiquitin by this NEDD8-specific E1 complex.
Belongs to the ubiquitin-activating E1 family. UBA3 subfamily.

feature.description: Reduces affinity for UBE2M; when associated with A-195 and A-197.
Reduces affinity for UBE2M; when associated with A-192 and A-197.
Reduces affinity for UBE2M; when associated with A-192 and A-195.
Reduces affinity for UBE2M; when associated with A-217.
Reduces affinity for UBE2M; when associated with A-214.
No effect on NEDD8 adenylation; impairs thioester intermediate formation.
No effect on NEDD8 adenylation or thioester intermediate formation; impairs NEDD8 transfer to UBE2M.
No effect on NEDD8 transfer to UBE2M.
No effect on NEDD8 transfer to UBE2M.
